Bases: object

This file contains the configuration parameters for the RLHF (Reinforcement Learning for Humans Feedback) model. The parameters are divided into three steps:

  • Step 1: SFT (Supervised Fine-Tuning) parameters

  • Step 2: Reward Modeling parameters

  • Step 3: Reinforcement Learning parameters

adafactor: bool | None = False#

class pykoi.rlhf.rlhf.RewardTrainer(rlhf_config: RLHFConfig)[source]#

Bases: Trainer

compute_loss(model, inputs, return_outputs=False)[source]#

How the loss is computed by Trainer. By default, all models return the loss in the first element.

Subclass and override for custom behavior.

create_datasets()[source]#

Load the dataset and preprocess it.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the train and eval datasets.

save(output_path=None)[source]#

Save the model.

Parameters:

output_path (str, optional) The output path to save the model. If not provided, the model will be saved to the default output path.

train_and_save(output_path=None)[source]#

Train the model and save it.

Parameters:

output_path (str, optional) The output path to save the model. If not provided, the model will be saved to the default output path.

class pykoi.rlhf.rlhf.SFT(rlhf_config: RLHFConfig)[source]#

Bases: Trainer

A class representing the supervised finetuning trainer.

rlhf_config#

The RLHF configuration object.

Type:

RLHFConfig

tokenizer#

The tokenizer used for tokenizing the input data.

Type:

AutoTokenizer

num_proc#

The number of workers to use for data loading.

Type:

int

dataset#

A dictionary containing the train and eval datasets.

Type:

Dict[str, Dataset]

torch_dtype#

The torch data type to use for training.

Type:

torch.dtype

training_args#

The training arguments for the trainer.

Type:

TrainingArguments

model#

The model to train.

Type:

AutoModelForCausalLM

trainer#

The trainer object used for training the model.

Type:

SFTTrainer

prepare_sample_text(example)[source]#

Prepare the text from a sample of the dataset.

Trains the model using the SFTTrainer object.
